text: I was craving Pho soup at 9pm on a Friday and I got what I wanted! The Tom Yum citronella soup was very tasty, very spicy too! I really liked the fried dumplings. The staff and lighting make for a good atmosphere, the only problem was the the whole place was almost completely silent when we stepped in: no music, hence the customers were almost whispering to each other. It got a bit better later. Good prices. BYOB. Take-out.
Vraiment bon! La soupe Tom Yum et le Pad Thai!!! Délicieux! Et en plus c'est un Apportez votre vin!

Great service! Love the vegetarian Pho soup. Authentic and well cooked. You can choose the size of the soup: either medium, large or extra large. We had the large soup and it is more than enough ! It very fresh and tasty, and the atmosphere is casual and relaxed.

Great food, great service, fun atmosphere and BYOB. What's not to like?! 
The owner was friendly and clearly knew the regulars but greeted the new comers with same energy and fun loving nature. Located right off rue Ste. Catherine, it made it easier to discover the village afterwards and see the boules roses.

Avez-vous déjà goûté un bon pad thaï?
Pas sûr, si vous n'êtes pas passés par Pho 21.

C'est toujours difficile de choisir entre ce grand champion et les crunchy noodles. C'est parce que TOUT est bon. 

Le serveur est sweet comme du chocolat de Pâques même s'il nous crie un peu dans les oreilles quand on entre, pour nous demander si ça va bien, et quand on commande. Autrement, le service est très courtois, on s'assure que tout va bien, quand c'est un peu long, on nous sert du thé, et on peut se divertir en regardant des vidéoclips louches à la télé au fond du resto des fois. 

On entre dans cet endroit qui n'a l'air de rien à prime abord (ni à l'extérieur, ni à l'intérieur!) et on se rend compte, à mesure qu'on met des choses dans notre bouche, que la bouffe de Pho 21 pourrait réparer des coeurs brisés. Du gros délice. 

Une étoile en moins parce que les toilettes, pas sûre, mais vous avez juste à ne jamais y aller et vous n'y verrez que du feu!!! FAYAAA!

Low key, no frills cafe atmosphere. The staff was very nice. The food was pretty average. I'd return because of the staff and low prices. 

note: based on my limited walking around Montreal, it appeared that Denis and St Laurent offered better restaurant options. Pho was located in a pretty cheesy, chain restaurant, touristy section of town
Stellar beef/chicken/shrimp. Honestly haven't had a better Vietnamese experience. No matter what the menu says, you can upgrade/add a tomyum soup... And definitely do it!

Pretty Standard

I saw this place when I was brunching across the street and my craving for Pho intensified. I decided to come to this place for dinner (plus the owners were watching the first Clinton/Trump debate in English) later that day. 

The restaurant is pretty low key, a lot of the items on the menu were written by hand. I did like the creaking wooden floors. Definitely, no frills, which can be good for a low key dinner. 

The service was pretty decent, for most of my meal I was the only person in the place. So, I cannot comment how the service is when the place is busy because I arrived around 9:15 and the restaurant closes at 10. Plus, the make owner kept asking if I was satisfied with the food. 

I ordered a small bowl of pho for $8.95 CAD. The broth was pretty delicious but the meat was really fatty, which was kind of disappointing. Also, the noodles were thicker than what I am used to in the states.  Overall, this place is pretty standard. Your mind will not be blown but the food is good enough for a quick and easy bite to eat. 

For the most part (if you do not have a Canadian credit or debit card), this place is cash only.
Accueil chaleureux. Beaucoup de choix. Prix très raisonnable, apportez votre vin. Nous allons revenir!!! Très bon!

Apportez votre vin !!! and good dishes served : tasty salmon and chicken with epinards. Les soupes just normal.

They have la table d'hote les soirées.

 litle kitsch decoration.

Lunch hebdomadaire avec les collègues. On y revient souvent parce que c'est très abordable, le service est juste parfait! Les gens sont souriants, la nourriture est servie rapidement, les plats sont toujours très chauds et les saveurs au rendez-vous. Pour le lunch on s'en tire pour 10$ et pour le souper entre 15 et 20$ par personne. Le pad thaï est excellent, beaucoup de basilic thaï et de poulet grillé et la portion est plutôt généreuse. Ça vaut le coup de partager avec les amis et de commander plusieurs plats pour goûter/déguster à autre chose, comme le poulet au cari, les rouleaux printemps ou impériaux. Bon appétit, il en faut quand on vient ici!
